channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Supercontinent Breakup Paved The Way For Complex Life On Earth
item.description: The breakup of an ancient supercontinent 1.5 billion years ago transformed Earth’s surface environments, paving the way for the emergence of complex l...

item.title: The Hacking Technique The Mafia Allegedly Used To Rig Poker Games
item.description: This edition of the Wiretap looks at securing AI agents, Apple's big bug bounty and more.

item.title: PayPal and UPS are sparking a late-session rally, powering stocks to fresh records
item.description: S&P added 0.4%, Dow Jones was up 0.6%, and the Nasdaq was 1% higher.

item.title: From retail to tech, here are the 10 corporations that recently announced mass layoffs
item.description: Companies are pointing to factors like tariff costs, shifts in consumer spending, and investments in AI that have led them to let go of thousands.

item.title: Our Generation’s Choice: Your Country’s AI Strategy Can Change Everything
item.description: AI has begun to shape society. The question is whether the resulting transformation will happen to or with us. A hybrid future that serves humanity re...

item.title: A federal judge just indefinitely barred the Trump administration from firing federal employees during the government shutdown
item.description: The judge previously issued a temporary restraining order against the job cuts that was set to expire on Wednesday.

item.title: Amazon to cut around 14K corporate jobs
item.description: Amazon will eliminate 14,000 corporate positions through internal restructuring, joining over 200 tech companies that cut 98,000 jobs this year.

item.title: As OpenAI restructures, Microsoft locks in long-term gains
item.description: OpenAI has become a public benefit corporation, giving Microsoft a 27% stake and long-term access to research methods

item.title: The U.S. just bet $1 billion that AI supercomputers can turn most cancers from ‘death sentences’ to ‘manageable conditions’ within 8 years
item.description: Chris Wright says the supercomputers will also allow the U.S. to “re-create the center of the sun on Earth” given how they benefit fusion energy resea...

item.title: Google Messages Is Copying A Key iMessage Feature – And It’s About Time
item.description: Google Messages is adding a trash folder for deleted texts, bringing it in line with iMessage and other messaging apps.

item.title: Autonomous Trains - Coming Soon to a Station Near You
item.description: Rail autonomy is coming to trains. The flexibility to move smaller batches of freight efficiently over short distance rail reduces highway congestion ...

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
